intro: Avenula adsurgens, commonly known as the climbing grass or climbing avenula, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and produces slender, climbing stems that can reach lengths of up to 3 meters. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, typically blooming in the spring. Avenula adsurgens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
